comments.body: These unit tests build with a relative path to the include files.  Because of this, I am doing the tests here rather than during the "test" phase of the conda recipe.  There may be a way around this but my hope is that it is acceptable to do these tests during the "build" phase.

It's nice to test if the relocation from the install prefix to testing prefix works.

You can persist files between building as testing using [this](https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build/en/latest/source/resources/define-metadata.html?highlight=selectors#source-files) and then pass `-I${PREFIX}/include`. (might need to be `${CONDA_PREFIX}`)

(It's not essential, just a suggestion for how you could do it.)
Actually it looks like the testing is already fine. (And using `source_files`! ðŸ˜† )

Thanks @chrisburr, these are a set of unit tests that differ a little bit from the tests done (with `source_files`.  I agree that it would be better to test with the include files once they're moved to the install location but I don't think doing these particular tests with the include files in `source_files` would really test that so I would prefer to leave it as is.
